snippet: Two recent diplomatic ventures have raised hopes that the United States will be able to strike Syria without compromising efforts toward easing tensions with Iran.
abstract: Two diplomatic ventures raise hopes that United States will be able to strike Syria without compromising efforts toward easing tensions with Iran; debate over chemical weapons raises questions about strength of Iran’s commitment to government of Syria's Pres Bashar al-Assad; Iran suffered terrible losses to chemical weapon strikes during its decade-long war with Iraq in 1980s, and issue is a delicate one for many Iranians.
lead_paragraph: Two recent diplomatic ventures have raised hopes that the United States will be able to strike Syria without compromising efforts toward easing tensions with Iran.

headline.main: Drawing a Line on Syria, U.S. Keeps Eye on Iran Policy
headline.print_headline: In Syria Crisis, U.S. Keeps Eye On Iran Policy
